channel.title: Day time after execution is too short
channel.description: There's so much going on in a game and once the results of an execution show, we only have like 5 or 7 seconds to decide if we want to change what to do that night if we have day->night abilities (like Prince jail). If I have to relook at my log real quick and then change my night target, I usually don't have enough time. I think we should get at least 15 seconds (preferrably a little more) after an execution to use/change our abilities/targets.

no, as in. say it when linked

item.description:
I wouldn’t recommend putting possessor codes in your logbook incase you have been replaced with the body you died.

Read full topic
item.source: Day time after execution is too short

item.title: Day time after execution is too short
item.dc:creator: Aurelia
item.description:
Personally i like day/night cycle. It’s good to have a breather and even though it might be short, it’s enough to vote someone else up / OR Edit your Logbooks accordingly
EXAMPLE-------

Player Accused Player B of treason (in this scenario, everyone voted him up)

Player B Claimed to be psychic
Player said that he should connect and say a code “3141592653589”
Next day they can confirm this or get him up.
If you’d be allowed too much time it’ll be too easy

Read full topic
item.source: Day time after execution is too short

item.source: Day time after execution is too short

item.title: Day time after execution is too short
item.dc:creator: danny135
item.description:
8 more seconds per execution for 8 days of executions would only add about a minute more. That’s pretty much nothing, and people usually don’t get executed every single day. A more reasonable time would be if 5 people get executed in a 9 day game. That would be 5*8 = 40 seconds more for a whole game. Barely anything, but you get a little bit more time to make your decisions for the night.

Read full topic
